intro: Eriocaulon melanolepis, commonly known as the black-stemmed ricegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with dark green leaves and a dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It is typically found in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in certain regions.
